option1: The "Delete" is used for deleting the standard objects, while on the other hand, the "Delete[]" is used to delete the pointer objects
option2: The "Delete" is a type of keyword, whereas the "Delete[]" is a type of identifier
option3: The "Delete" is used for deleting a single standard object, whereas the "Delete[]" is used for deleting an array of the multiple objects

answer: The "Delete" is used for deleting a single standard object, whereas the "Delete[]" is used for deleting an array of the multiple objects

question: Which of the following statement is correct about Virtual Inheritance?

option3: It is a technique to optimize the multiple inheritances
option4: It is a technique to avoid the multiple inheritances of the classes
answer: It is a C++ technique to avoid multiple copies of the base class into the derived or child classes
